title: Wildfire smoke lofted miles high could have an unexpected effect on Earth's climate
description: New measurements demonstrate that smoke particles in the upper atmosphere are twice the size of lower-altitude ones.
content: New measurements demonstrate that smoke particles in the upper atmosphere are twice the size of lower-altitude ones.
